main event: A flying saucer was reported over Chattanooga, Tennessee on 23 March 1950 by Mr. and Mrs. R.L. Woodwall and the sighting duration was approximately 2 minutes.
interesting points: The object appeared to be about 200 feet long and 40 feet wide, blinking on and off at 1000 ft. altitude at 1000 daily.

The Weather Bureau released a sounding balloon that was likely what the witnesses observed, as weather balloons frequently reflect the sun's rays in a manner that makes them appear round and silver-like.
Mr. and Mrs. Woodwall reported sighting a round silver object in the sky heading toward Lovell, but neither could estimate its altitude or speed.
The sighting was reported in the Chattanooga News-Free Press on the same date as the event.
No further investigation was planned by the officials, and liaison with local newspapers was set up to relay any further reports of unidentified flying objects.
sighted object: a round, silver object in the sky
